subject: Re: [junit] Re: JUnit bug for XML testing?
msgSnippet: ... The best idea would be to make new releases that fix bugs.  Second, XP teams release to their end users frequently as well.
messageBody:
> Another idea would be to update the FAQ so that this particular
> problem could be more readily associated with the FAQ that provides
> the answer.


The best idea would be to make new releases that fix bugs. "Second, XP
teams release to their end users frequently as well."
[http://xprogramming.com/xpmag/whatisxp.htm#small%5d

> Actually, I don't mean to be a critic, but the documentation for
> J/Unit really sucks. I know, I know... if I don't like it I should do
> better... Well, I've only been using J/Unit for a couple of days now
> so I'm not prepared yet to write docs.


- documentation sucks: +1
- since you're new to the product, you cannot write documentation: -1

You can write/update documentation about:
- how to install JUnit (with/without ant, classpath problems, solutions...)
- how to verify your installation
- how to write your first tests
- how to organize your tests

I know that a lot of different and excellent articles exist about these
subjects but if you still have "newbie" questions on the newsgroup it
means either:
- users don't read the documentation
or
- the documentation is not good enough.

I really think that a product downloaded more than 150,000 times should
have a better documentation/community.

-Vladimir

--
Vladimir Bossicard
